intro: Kosteletzkya wetarensis, commonly known as the Wetar morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine with heart-shaped leaves and produces showy blooms that attract pollinators. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in coastal areas and disturbed soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated for its beauty and ecological benefits.
